Reviews.Title: “Waterside views from a gorgeous garden - in central Venice”
Reviews.Author: weekend_for_two
Reviews.Content: If you're in the mood for a treat, this is the place. We opted for Ca' Nigra for the second stop on our honeymoon in September, and we'd thoroughly encourage anyone to follow our footsteps. The room was stunning, hotel standards excellent, the place itself has real history and charm, and the staff made us very welcome indeed. Breakfasting in the garden is a real pleasure in Venice. Anyone who's been there will recognise the paucity of green spaces, so to start the day with espresso, pastries and fruit in the sunshine is stunning - as real treat. Mind you, since Ca' Nigra offers drinks at sunset it's an absolute pleasure to start the evening with something nice watching the boats and gondolas cruise past before heading into the town. The hotel is superhumanly easy to locate whether you arrive by train or plane - not even five minutes walking from the main station. And it's easy to spot from the bridges or the other side of the Grand Canal too, given the lush garden. Location-wise it's a ten/fifteen minute wiggle through the Venetian alleyways to San Marco, but within easy immediate striking distance of a few pleasant (and more "local") campi; the staff recommended some great spots to us, not necessarily on the beaten track, but getting out isn't an issue if you're happy to wander and explore. Get a room with a canalside view - opening the doors to your balcony over the water (spectacular Gran Canal or the smaller/quieter Rio Marin) never gets dull, and be sure to get a boat taxi. The hotel has it's own speedboat undeground picking up spot, which doesn't exactly make for a bad start to the evening. Already saving to go back for an anniversary...

Reviews.Title: “Wake to Church Bells and a Green Garden”
Reviews.Author: RoamWriter
Reviews.Content: Desiring to avoid the crowds of the high season and the carnival, I stayed at this palazzo, or palace, four nights in January. While the rate of around 200 euro a night was steep, I think I got what I paid for. I can recommend my room, #11, located on the first floor just past the reception desk. It was large with antique appointments and a modern sleek bathroom designed with Italian sensibilities. It was a pleasure to swing open the roomâ€™s windows and gaze out upon the little narrow canal that runs alongside the building, watching the gondolas and work boats gliding by just a few yards away. Best of all, the room has a private door that opens directly onto one of the resortâ€™s two gardens. As other reviewers have mentioned, this first floor room was noisy and I could hear voices from the reception desk areaâ€”a particular problem when one is trying to sleep. I think the management could solve this problem by installing a second set of soundproof doors in the room, or perhaps just a sliding acoustic curtain. There is certainly sufficient room for such an accommodation in the doorâ€™s large frame. My own solution was a travelerâ€™s expedient: I pretended the people outside were my relatives chatting away in the kitchen. I did a little investigation of the other rooms on the first floor: #10, adjacent to mine, is a little smaller and also has a direct door to the same private garden. #12 is directly across the reception area; #13, #14 and #15 are down a short hallway adjacent to the breakfast area; none have direct access to a garden. #15 seemed the best of the last lot and is adjacent to an exterior door that takes you out to yet another garden on the Grand Canal. Breakfast consisted of high quality biscuits and croissants, and great coffee (I asked for â€œlongâ€� or American coffee) in the hotelâ€™s charmingly designed breakfast area. Request their menu of additional paid-for choices (I had prunes and muesli) if itâ€™s not on the table. After breakfast I wandered out onto the hotelâ€™s front garden and watched the busy boat traffic on the Grand Canal. Negotiating Veniceâ€™s narrow, maze-like streets can be challenging for the first-time traveler, so I was fortunate to reserve rooms within a 10-minute walk of the train station (Stazione Santa Lucia). When I left the station I turned left and walked a short distance through a busy area packed with small hotels and restaurants to a pedestrian bridge (Ponted. Scalzi) over the Grand Canal. (Be prepared to climb 40 modestly graduated steps to the top, then the same number down). Once off the bridge I walked straight ahead, taking the second left (the first is a dead end, as I discovered) and continued a short distance over a smaller bridge, then past an ancient church (S. Simeone Grande). I turned left at the first opportunity and found myself on an open square, or campo. The entrance to the hotel was just ahead to the left. It occurred to me that travelers with heavy luggage might want to avoid the large bridge near the train station and take the vaporetto, or water bus, instead. So I also traced out that route, taking the #1 line at the Ferrovia stop, located in front of the train station. (Take the boat marked â€œLido,â€� rather than â€œP. Le Roma,â€� which goes the other direction). I traveled one stop to the Riva Di Biasio station. Leaving the boat I turned right, walked to the second left and walked a few yards to the first right, which took me down a narrow street to the open square. Ca Nigra was straight ahead. As the above remarks suggest, it would be prudent to obtain a good quality street map prior to arrival in Venice, which presents the traveler with a confusing maze of walkways. Be prepared for some backtracking, though: I did not find a single map that was really accurate. Even Google maps is confounded by the cityâ€™s idiosyncratic medieval sensibilities. Donâ€™t be in a hurry to get anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Could do better!”
Reviews.Author: Tian Y
Reviews.Content: Great location! this is especially important in Venice. I got room 101, no Wifi signal in that room, I had to sit in the sitting room for internet, and its â‚¬5/3hs. When I asked the reception for recommendation for good seafood restaurants in Venice at around 3pm just after check in, they told me that restaurants in Venice close at 3pm, so I'd better eat at their hotel. :( they must think that I am from Mars! over all, they are not worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: aginsf
Reviews.Content: We stayed here there for three nights, and found the rooms and service excellent. It's a grand old Venetian Palazzo, and you are in some ways transported back to another era. Our room had a history of the hotel and the man who built it. Interesting! VERY close to the Rail Station, yet far enough away so you are very removed from incessant tourist foot traffic and associated noise. Hotel is on the Grand Canal with the canal-front garden providing an excellent vantage point for the Regatta Storica and for some quiet relaxation time during the evening to see what was occurring on the Canal. Breakfast is served indoors and in the garden terrace. Breakfast is good; standard pastries, breads, coffee, and juice. Eggs and other items cost extra. Service was excellent. Thanks to TripAdvisor, we knew to ask for a room that was above the ground floor. We were not disappointed. Terrazzo floors, antique furniture, modern bathroom...beautiful! As mentioned in other review, "male manager during the week day was very stiff shirt and snobby." We found him helpful and courteous. A General Strike was called for a day we were to check out, and we thought our trains/planes mightbe cancelled. He assured us he'd held us find accomodation for another night should it become necessary. Also let us borrow umbrellas on a rainy day. Cons: Internet connection (wifi) in room was spotty at best, and is not free. 5 Euros for 3 hours = 3 hours total useage, and not 3 contiguous hours. Wifi signal very strong in the public areas of the hotel. AC was too cold, we couldnt figure out how to reduce the cooling the temp and staff could not help with this either. But...hey...we had AC during a very hot and humid time, so this is *not* a complaint. Only other annoyance, we wanted a "nightcap" and coincidentally, another couple from the hotel did as well at the same time. Since the kitchen and food service were closed at the time (23:00), we had to wait for the front desk person to get some whiskies and grappas for us. ABout 10 minute wait...and the point is they made the effort to serve their guests. Great job!

Reviews.Title: “Great gem in Venice”
Reviews.Author: bittercool
Reviews.Content: My B&B in Venice was overbooked and the owner kindly got me a room at Ca'Nigra. First thought I had was - why is this hotel not full as it was the peak summer holiday season (Jul 2010). Nonetheless, my skepticism was unfounded. The hotel was located at a decent location, close to the train station (even better than the B&B I originally booked). There was a nice garden for breakfast overseeing the Grand Canal, al'fresco ala Venezia style. The room itself is spacious and comfortable. Unfortunately, there was no free wifi - you need to pay for it at the hotel frontdesk.

Reviews.Title: “Super Excellent”
Reviews.Author: rskuster
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great, located on the Grand Canal in a residential part of the city, so it is not overflowing with tourists. It is across the bridge from the main train station, and close to a Vaporetto Stop (less than 20 mins. on the Vaporetto to Plaza San Marco). The hotel is gorgeous (a former mansion), well kept, with a wonderful garden right on the Grand Canal. The service was excellent, and the rooms absolutely amazing. We had a junior suite, the most affordable option I think, and the room was very spacious, with a comfortable bed, modern bathroom etc. The staff was very attentive, and breakfast was delicious. I highly recommend this hotel and will definitely stay there again during my next visit. The only thing that was not optimal was the lack of free wireless internet and even with paying 5EUR for 3 hrs, the wireless connection was a bit spotty in our room. But then again, we didn't really need internet as Venice has so much to offer it would have been a waste to spend too much time in the room (as beautiful and comfortable as it was).

Reviews.Title: “4 Star Hotel with price to go with it, but Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: W M
Reviews.Content: Stay there over two night, and found the rooms and service excellent. Close to the Rail Station, transport and on the Grand Canal with the garden providing an excellent vantage point during the evening to see what was occurring on the Canal. Service was excellent, but as indicated by one of the other reviewers, a roomnear reception would be very noisy and the male manager during the week day was very stiff shirt and snobby. Would stay again, but not during July - August, just too many people during the European Holiday season!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful rooms, first class service”
Reviews.Author: Grknyc
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a excellent location. A five minute walk from the train station. Fully modern rooms, great friendly english speaking staff, beautiful garden. A ten minute walk to the Jewish ghetto. The perfect spot for the Shomer Shabbos traveler

Reviews.Title: “Nice venetian hotel”
Reviews.Author: Southsider20
Reviews.Content: We hadn't booked a hotel on our arrival in Venice and were recommended by the local hotel finder - AKA a yellow kiosk by the car park. She did say it was a 5 minute walk from the car park, it was more like 15 and she didn't tell us about the 4 lots of bridges with lots of stairs we would need to climb with luggage in tow. The hotel itself was very nicely furnished, the room we had was large with views of the canal. Was disappointed there was no tea and coffee facilities or iron/ironing board. The female staff were helpful and the male member of staff (hotel manager??) was helpful until we cancelled the water taxi which was a rip off at EUR50 to the car park (we had paid 60 to go St Marks Square about 6 times the distance) he was annoyed even though we had asked for a price before we booked. The hotel garden was a lovely setting for breakfast, which was a bit hit and miss we got pastries and others had fruit platters?? The location was right on the canal but you need to get a water taxi or water bus to get to the main sights. Overall our stay was pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE -AS YOU MIGHT NOT BE STAYING HERE!”
Reviews.Author: Louise M
Reviews.Content: we booked this hotel through our tour operator for the first night of our honeymoon, upon arrival we were informed that the hotel and double booked us and we were being re-located in the apartments owned by the hotel. Having travelled for 12 hours and carried suitcases over bridges in 37 degree heat we refused to leave the beautifull surroundings of the hotel we had carefully selected for an apartment at the other side of venice. We were re-assured it was every bit as nice and we would even have our own space. I asked how would we get our breakfast in the apartments and the rude receptionist replied it is already waiting there as none of the breakfasts are fresh anyway!! Which i found hard to believe for a 4* hotel! We were practically kicked out of the hotel and had to travel and hour and half to the other side of venice were we had to try find the dingiest darkest first floor flat up a narrow side street. We were told it would take 20 mins! It was so shockingly horrible that my husband refused to spend the first night of our honeymoon in such a disgusting place, i have stayed in much nicer hostels that i paid very little for. It was also rated as 3* but i wouldnt have given it 2* and we paid for 4*. There was no air conditioning, very noisy as it was above a restaurant, very dark with black beams on ceiling, couldnt open curtains as we were looking in other peoples windows about 1m away, the door fell of the cabinet, the breakfast was a croisant in a packet! All sourounding hotels were fully booked and we had to stay in it,. DO NOT BE FOOLED into booking the pretty picture of this hotel and ending up in there apartments. It seemed to be fairly normal practice as they had maps of how to get to thier apartments at the reception of the hotel. We feel totally cheated by this hotel!!!!! DO NOT STAY HERE as you might not be staying here

Reviews.Title: “Could do better”
Reviews.Author: PaulBR69
Reviews.Content: Overall our experience was disappointing which was a shame as the hotel has lots going for it. The position is good - quiet, close to the rail station and away from the crowds. Taking breakfast in the garden each morning looking onto the Grand Canal was lovely - and the waiting staff were friendly and helpful and the breakfast good. We were let down by an unfriendly welcome from the member of staff on reception, the appointment of one of our rooms on the ground floor near to the busy reception area - noise was audible. And the lack of bar service at 11pm was disappointing. There was a problem with our bill on departure - we were charged for mini bar items we did not consume and although it was eventually sorted out it could have been done in a more customer focussed way. There just seemed to be problems with lots of things which were dealt with in such a way we ended up feeling like we were the problem. The hotel positions itself as 'boutique', 'design' and 'luxury' - but in my view it needs to make some changes to live up to these claims. Ensuring that guests feel welcome during their stay would be a good start...

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with lousy service”
Reviews.Author: Bart B
Reviews.Content: I've been staying here for 2 nights during a business trip to Venice. The hotel is situated close to the railway station, but quite far away from the tourist's highlights (Rialto, San Marco,...). Upon arrival I asked for a quite room. I got a room on the ground level opposite the front desk. Not the best choice if you want to go to bed early like I did. The man at the front desk was far from sympathetic. He just ignored my question. The room was rather small but nicely decorated and clean. However the last morning I killed some ants walking on my bed carpet. I was staying here on a business trip, so I needed a WiFi connection. It's surprising you still have to pay for this in a modern 4*-hotel in 2011! Breakfast was ok for 1 or 2 nights and depends on the mood. The first morning I got no more than some sandwiches and pastry. The second morning I received the same pastries with yoghurt, fresh fruit,... I guess you have to be lucky with that. So is this a good hotel? It certainly has a lot of potential and some positive points (modern rooms, nice garden next to the Canal Grande,...), but it lacks in service and enthousiasm! It's as if you're not welcome at all and the staff just don't care about you. Quite disappointing!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely occasion - stayed in better”
Reviews.Author: BeverlyKing
Reviews.Content: Very expensive for room that was supposedly upgraded to a superior suite. No comfortable sitting area and tv the smallest. Shower silly size and against a full length window! No flexibility in breakfast choices. Badly ripped off for transfers from Treviso by hotel - pompous chap on Reception also demanded we pay in cash and wouldn't give receipt !! Fishy, we thought....

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: marianrepetto
Reviews.Content: Great location on the Grand Canal. Very quiet. Vaporettos close by. Friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Fab location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Pamelja
Reviews.Content: Not sure why this hotel would call itself a resort, but it's a lovely albeit quirky place in a fantastic location just a short walk from the grand canal. The hotel's charming garden, where you can enjoy breakfast or an afternoon drink, overlooks the canal. The hotel had been updated at some point and the addition of a glass shower precluded the bathroom windows from opening, but one of the hotel's small quirks. The front desk staff was incredibly patient and accommodating, and with the exception of recommending the worst restaurant in Venice (Alba Nova) their suggestions were spot on. The room was spacious with casement windows and lovely views. I'd go back.

Reviews.Title: “Beauty and the Beast”
Reviews.Author: Mike2551
Reviews.Content: A peaceful and tranquil hotel. Very chic. Good location within easy reach of P Roma. Good to return from the crowded touristy parts to the quieter streets of S Croce. Very pleasant to have breakfast in the garden ovelooking the Grand Canal. Most staff welcoming and friendly. BUT, all that changed as a result of an incident on our penultimate evening. We returned to our room in the late afternoon to find the shower glass panel shattered and with broken glass on the floor. We immediately reported this to reception. The manager arrived and within minutes accused us of the damage; according to him, he had checked the mini bar and the bathroom earlier that afternoon and the room was fine. Very authoriative in his manner; unsympathetic; accusatory and rude - he left the hotel later that eveing without offering any solutions or sanctioning a change of room. Upon our insistence he contacted us later in the evening only to demand 400 euros; he was in no way sympathetic or concerned about us. We refused to comply as we saw this as an admission of guilt. He was unbending, so we asked him to involve the poice to whom we would gladly give statements. Only when we contacted our tour company, did he back down; however, we received the "cold shoulder" from him, left the next day without being able to shower and feeling very badly treated throughout the whole incident. What started as a lovely holiday break, was soured by the incident and the fact that this one manager's handling of the situation, and his manner and attitude to us, made us feel like liars and criminals. We were never informed of the "true events" which caused the breakage, but left feeling that our integrity and honesty had been brought into question. Interesting how one incident, one person in a position of authority and the way in which a situation can be badly managed, can marr an expensive holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful garden hotel in idyllic location”
Reviews.Author: LondonStravaiger
Reviews.Content: The Ca Nigra is a really delightful hotel in an idyllic spot on the Grand Canal. The hotel's greatest feature is its garden looking out over the canal where you can take breakfast or an aperitif in the evening. Its a really peaceful spot to sit and watch the water borne world go by. The hotel is diagonally opposite the rail station, across a fairly steep bridge, but is a million miles away from the bustle surrounding the station. It is also walking distance (5-10 mins) to the Piazzale Roma which is the main bus and road taxi terminal. The closest vaparetto stop is Riva di Biassio - a stop for the No 1 vaparetto. This is a pretty slow stopping service which takes around 40 minutes to get to San Marco. It may be worth going across to the station to get a wider and faster range of services. If you arrive by water taxi, the hotel has its own boat house off the canal which the taxi can pull in to. The hotel doesn't have a restaurant, but there are plenty of very nice places to eat within about 10 mins walk - but it may be worth booking if you see one you like as they are mostly small and quite busy. We particularly enjoyed the Il Refolo pizzeria. For lunchtime drinks and snacks Da Baffo (en route to San Polo and the Rialto) and L'Archivo (opposite the Frari) were nice. We had rooms on the second floor (203 and 208) which were fairly spacious and individually furnished. 208 had a view out to the Grand Canal and out to the garden, 203 looks out over the side canal. The bathrooms with walk in showers were very smart and modern. For our stay this was a perfect choice and I'd go back any time. I have marked down for value as you may feel it is expensive for what is essentially a bed and breakfast, however for us it was entirely worth it.

Reviews.Title: “history with a modern bent”
Reviews.Author: barbara532
Reviews.Content: Everyone was very cordial & helpful. The building was renovated from Napoleon III but stood on original site from the 1200's. Wonderful antiques amidst glass & stainless steel.

Reviews.Title: “the best place in Vence”
Reviews.Author: FranzLEoben
Reviews.Content: This hotel on the Canal Grande with a special and romantic garden on the Canal,we have reserved for our honeymoon the room n 206 the top! that is true! Good service and high standard for tis boutique Hotel

Reviews.Title: “An elegant hotel in a peaceful part of the city”
Reviews.Author: londongirl41
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a weekend in Venice and enjoyed a wonderful stay in the Ca'Nigra which was one of the best parts of the visit. The hotel is in a quieter part of the city which was ideal for escaping all the (many) other tourists like ourselves and ideal for arrival from Treviso airport on the transfer coach. The location is on the grand canal and though we had a room overlooking a side canal we were still able to enjoy the benefits of the main view from reception areas. Rooms are very elegant with antique and eclectic furnishings which are found throughout the public areas. Breakfast was a very generous and delicious continental style which we enjoyed in the room. Staff were unfailingly helpful and friendly (we certainly didn't experience any of the negative aspects mentioned in other reviews) and all in all helped to make a very relaxed and pleasant stay. I would heartily recommend this hotel and if we were to return to venice would happily return.

Reviews.Title: “When is a suite not a suite?”
Reviews.Author: SparksFyldeCoast
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews of this hotel, we were disappointed in our experience. Yes, the building is lovely and the position on the Grand Canal unrivalled. The hotel is quiet and the garden at the front is very pleasant. Our room however was a disappointment. it was sold as a suite but was simply a room (with a very small bathroom). The first room we were shown to, also meant to be a suite, was also just one normal room and had a limited view of the garden being at ground level. We were hoping for a canal view but even in the room we were moved to on the first floor we had only a side window view of a 'branch' canal. Maybe we expected too much but at Â£600 for two nights with continental breakfast onlt included we felt this was not good value for money. Whilst staff in the breakfast room were very pleaseant man on reception hadn't even a smile for us and it did not feel particularly welcoming

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, yes, but these guys are crooks”
Reviews.Author: austrianinLA
Reviews.Content: We were charged twice in what is starting to look more and more like fraud. First, we were charged for an extra day that we didn't stay there and told that they were "cancelling" the first transaction and issuing another bill. The only problem is that they, to this day, dispute that the first transaction was erroneous and insist that both transaction were justified. Even Visa couldn't convince them, not to mention our fifty phone calls and emails. I'd rather poke my eye out than go back to a place like that. They're crooks.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden oasis in Venice”
Reviews.Author: cemckeon
Reviews.Content: When I arrived at this hotel (close to Santa Lucia train station), I was surprised and happy to see that this hotel had a lawn and trees. It was a hidden oasis in Venice, where you mostly encounter buildings and streets. It was a bit of an escape in a crowded and congested city. Room was nice, but ask for a room on a higher floor. We were on the ground floor near the dining area so we heard a lot of dishes clanging. That explains why ear plugs were waiting for us in our room! Staff provided excellent restaurant recommendation off the beaten path - Trattoria Antica Besseta. While it may be tempting to open the window in your room, don't do it. The smell from the canals takes a long time to dissipate.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis on the Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: Traveller006
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel for a second time. The visit confirmed us in the belief that it is an outstanding place to stay when visiting Venice; we shall certainly seek to go back. Its location is ideal, both when arriving in Venice and when going from the hotel to explore the city - by foot or by vaparetto. It stands actually on the Grand Canal, albeit at the "unfashionable" end of the canal. It has a parterre garden overlooking the canal and a green garden on the other side of the building - an extraordinary bonus for this crowded city. The building is attractive and the overal effect provides a real oasis away from the crowded streets. The interior is immaculate, cool and quiet - very modern, but with old features and furnishings cleverly blended in. The bedrooms and the beds are very comfortable indeed, with immaculate linen; it is certainly worth paying the (fairly modest) extra cost for a superior room, rather than a standard room. Perhaps it is even worth paying for a suite - we would not know! But in any event, the room rates are extremely good value. We booked on the hotel's own website. The breakfast is "light"/continental, but of high quality and beautifully presented in a very quiet breakfast area. Two small reservations: - The desk staff could show slightly more warmth. - The very modern designer bathrooms might not be to everyone's taste! For example, the concept of a shower door was evolved for a very good reason; showers should continue to have doors! But these are very small points. Overall, we think that it would be absurd to seek to stay anywhere else in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Success for our surprise wedding anniversary trip”
Reviews.Author: JandSD
Reviews.Content: After a lot of research I booked this as a surprise trip for our wedding anniversary. We were very pleased with the hotel indeed - OK we only had their "basic" Junior Suite but it was very comfortable, well equipped and clean - even with a Grand Canal view from a side window (room 205). Breakfast in the the well-tended garden right on the edge of the Grand Canal was fantastic. Very convenient location for the vaporetti in front of the train station or for walking across to the Rialto and onto St Mark's. The hotel has been renovated stylishly but sympathetically to a very high standard. The staff generally were very helpful and attentive - especially at breakfast. We would highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Stay in a palace in Venice”
Reviews.Author: CaryTarHeel
Reviews.Content: My first trip to Venice and I was so thrilled that I picked this hotel to stay in. Venice is spread among several neighborhoods but this is by far the best place to stay. It is a 5 minute walk from the train station and even closer to the water bus stops. Located on the main canal in a 13th century palace. Small and quant. It felt like we were staying as guests of royalty. Original mosaic floors in the guest rooms and in hallways are stunning. Morano glass chandeliers line the halls and in rooms. Beatiful terraces are a great spot to share a bottle of Prosecco. Breakfast is delicious and served overlooking the Grand Canal. This is a quieter area of Venice is which a great escape from the noise of St. Marks.

Reviews.Title: “An excelente choice in Venice, Italy”
Reviews.Author: bertolanipalici
Reviews.Content: Ca' Nigra is an excelent choice to saty in Venice, Italy. A quiet, confortable, a fancy and lovely decotarion of rooms and all hotel, located in a part of the city, the most beautiful part of Venice: the real Venice. A few minutes of walking, takes you to the most beautiful places of the city, and the most touristic points of interest. A clean hotel, very well kept, and with a staff that makes you feel like if you were home. In front of Gran Canale, is an old Palace totally restored to give the guests, confort, privacy and safety. In an extremelly romantic enviroment. We've been in a room, with a balcony, with full view to the gardens and the Gran Canale, and it was perfect to our purposal ( honeymoon). You also can count on transfer directly from the airport and back or to the port, made by boats booked directly to the hotel manager, and a private boat garage leaves you inside the hotel. We really recommend this hotel to everyone who wants the best stay in Venice, in a great style.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel but very poor service”
Reviews.Author: imsuchafuss
Reviews.Content: we were upgraded to deluxe room. spacious - well worth e usd300++. bathroom great but no bath tub! breakfast was good. location - venice is small. just WALK! only disappointment is the service staff. and im not talking bout just one staff. all the front desk staff were not helpful at all when asked bout touristy bits. they just brush me off. even e manager was lacking some serious PR skills. so my advise is - do enough research so u dont have to talk / ask front desk anything!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - perfect location”
Reviews.Author: LawDogg
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 4 nights in May for our 5th anniversary. We have absolutely no complaints (We did get a "good" deal around $300/night, which is decent for the quality of the hotel, time of year and Venice in general, from what I've seen). We're in our low 30's. Service was fine, the breakfast was nice, and the front rose garden was beautiful - we could eat breakfast there (right on the Grand Canal!) and when we got back in the evening, we could relax at a table and hear live music coming from restaurants right across the Grand Canal, before we went to bed. We also loved getting back from a day of sightseeing --- we knew when we were close to home, because you could literally smell the jasmine that covers various walls in the beautiful courtyard. The A/C worked well (as well as any, in our experience in Europe in general, and Venice had a heat wave when we were there, with temps in the high 80s/low 90s). Our room was very nice -- it didn't blow us away, but we had no complaints, the bed was comfortable, etc. As for those who have an issue with the distance from St. Mark's Square, Doge's Palace, etc. --- for us, we had absolutely no issue with this. We bought a 3-day pass for the Vaporetto (the water "bus"), and very much enjoyed taking it to anywhere we wanted to go. When we got to the main sights and walked around, we realized we wouldn't have *wanted* to stay anywhere near that area anyway, because it was quite crowded and certainly more noisy. We highly recommend Ca' Nigra - their response to our e-mails prior to our trip were very courteous and timely. It's also very convenient to the bus/train station from which many people may arrive...a five minute walk to the hotel from there (if you don't get lost! just follow the *Grand Canal*), or a 60 second water taxi, I suppose. Enjoy Venice, we loved it --- it was a magical, unique place!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Long Weekend in Venezia”
Reviews.Author: NWF_Copenhagen
Reviews.Content: The hotel garden was fantastic. We had breakfast in the morning in garden next to the Grand Canal - and drinks in the evening before going out into the Venetian nightlife. It is one of the few green spots in the city â€“ so it is a privilege to sit there and watch the boats sail by. We upgraded our room to a junior suite with a balcony â€“ and that was a good choice. The room was large, nice and had great view. It cost real money! But it was worth it. We can recommend taking a private boat tour to or from the hotel. Caâ€™ Nigra have their own boat house, which is very â€œJames Bondâ€� â€¦ Originally we were a bit concerned that the hotel was located so far away from San Marco, but it turned out to be perfect since it has perfect striking distance for San Polo and Dorsaduro, so we got to see a lot more than we expect if we had stayed at the other side of Venice. Four stars often mean that you risk that the staff is very stuffy and correct. But the Caâ€™ Nigra staff was very helpful and warm. We can warmly recommend Caâ€™ Nigra.

Reviews.Title: “The best you can get in Venice”
Reviews.Author: RomaPalu
Reviews.Content: The best you can get. Confortable; ideal position; wonderfull service; romantic atmosphere. I have been there 7 times, alone and with my husband, and I will consider it the only place to go when in Venice. The owner is a charming lady; the director a very efficient man.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast at the Canale Grande”
Reviews.Author: Gugulie
Reviews.Content: To enjoy a nice breakfast direktly at the Canale Grande in the hotel's own rosegarden - that was just perfect for our little wedding-anniversary-weekend trip to Venice. The hotel is located at a very good spot - just a few minutes from the trainstation S.Lucia and a few more minutes from Piazzale Roma, a vaporetto station is just around the corner. The hotel itself doesn't have many rooms which makes it even more personal. It's quiet and comfortable, a great mixture between old Venice Palazzo restaurated and combined with modern steel and glas elements. We had a room on ground floor next to the reception but thought it was very quiet. We even had a tiny porch to sit outside in the second garden of the hotel - a nice place of rest after walking around amoungst all these other tourist in the full streets of Venice. The people working there were very friendly and helpful. We enjoyed every minute of it and will come again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: gstea
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous place! I do raccomand it! Lovely, helpful and ready staff. Closed to the facilities and to main attractions, 10 minutes from nice shopping in Rialto Bridge. I had the time of my life in the romantic nearby.

Reviews.Title: “What a gem!”
Reviews.Author: tartangirl51
Reviews.Content: My sister and I arrived late at night on a flight from London. We took the bus to Piazzale Roma and easily walked to the Ca'Nigra in 10 minutes. Its easy to find, even although its years since either of us had been in Venice. Our room was gorgeous - huge, with windows overlooking a canal, and decorated in an ornate, traditional Venetian style with antique furniture. The bathroom was a complete contrast but also fab: totally modern with stylish chrome fixtures and a stunning shower. All the staff were warm and friendly, and very helpful. Breakfast was excellent: a typical European breakfast of fresh sweet and savory pastries, croissants, toast, freshly squeezed oj and yogurt. The location is great: close to the station and a choice of two vaporetto stops. It may not have all night room service, but it is a boutique hotel, so who really expects that? Its a lovely hotel, with a pretty garden overlooking the Grand Canal, a perfect base for exploring and enjoying Venice, come rain or shine - and we had both!

Reviews.Title: “Overrated”
Reviews.Author: stantheman2
Reviews.Content: A hugely overpriced hotel that is nowhere near 4 star. its a good 3 star. No room service or food available at 11 in the evening after a long journey there. when we asked for a small bottle of red wine to have with a mini bar snack we were told none was available (in italy!). there was no hair conditioner available next morning (can live with that!). asked for the owner/manager to recommend a romantic restaurant on the water with atmos - he recommended a bright, modern restaurant not on the water. our room (supposedly a suite) was tiny with a bizarre layout where the entire bathroom was surrounded by glass walls but no blinds! not ideal if on the great white phone! the staff were surly, rude and very self important with the exception of the night manager who was pleasant and helpful one can definitely do better in venice for the money. only redeeming quality was a reasonable location near to grand canal (But again the much hyped views of the canal are a misnomer as the garden is surrounded by walls). wont be going back.
